author: Special Correspondent
text:
Miscreants broke into a mobile store in Nungambakkam and robbed 11 high-end phones and Rs. 25,000 in cash, on Monday night.

Police said Habeeb Ahmed of Nandanam, owned the store on Rama Street in Nungambakkam. On Monday night, he closed the shop around 10 p.m and went home.

When he came to the shop around 10 a.m on Tuesday, he found the shutter locks broken and the valuables stolen. Investigations are on.

Mobile theft: police nab two minors

City police arrested two youngsters on charges of stealing a mobile phone from a 23-year-old man in Kilpauk on Monday.

Jeganathan (23), police said, was waiting in Kilpauk when two men on a motorcycle snatched his mobile phone and sped away.

He lodged a complaint with the police immediately.

The police conducted vehicle checks and nabbed the suspects — both were minors.

They are reportedly involved in many cell phone thefts in the city.

Investigations are on.

ATM card stolen on bus, woman loses Rs. 80,000

An unidentified man withdrew Rs. 80,000 from an account held by a woman after her ATM card was stolen while she was travelling on an MTC bus from Arumbakkam on Monday.

Kamala Devi from Andamans, had come to Chennai for a treatment and after she was discharged from a private hospital in Anna Nagar, she was on her way to Old Washermanpet, to shop before her returned back home.

When travelling in the bus, she discovered that her wallet with her ATM card was stolen. She lodged a complaint with the Washermenpet police station. However in the evening, she received a withdrawal message from the bank. Police said that the woman had written her PIN number on the card.
title: 11 mobile phones, Rs. 25,000 robbed from shop
